isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - INSTALL - DIFFERENTIAL AND CLUTCH PACK ASSEMBLY IN CARRIER

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL AND CLUTCH PACK ASSEMBLY IN CARRIER

note.para: Lubricate bearings during the following assembly procedure:

step1.para: Place ring gear and differential assembly in carrier. Insure that ring gear and drive pinion mesh properly.
During installation, tilt carrier to allow support case pilot to rest in carrier bore, then install bearing cup ( Figure 34). Also install bearing cup on opposite side of differential.

figure.caption: Figure 34. Tilt Carrier to Allow Support Case Pilot to Rest in Carrier Bore

step1.para: If the same gear set is used, install the assembled bearing cap, adjuster and lock on the backface side of the ring gear ( Figure 35). Otherwise install adjuster and cap separately.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Install Assembled Bearing Cap, Adjuster and Lock

step1.para: On teeth side of ring gear, install the other adjuster and bearing cap.

note.para: When installing bearing caps, it may be necessary to tap lightly with a hammer. Be sure bearing caps are fully seated and threads are aligned properly. If trouble is encountered, check for cross-threading of bearing adjuster and carrier threads.

step1.para: Install and tighten bearing cap bolts finger tight. If this is difficult, use hand wrench ( Figure 36).
